commit.message:
Pluralise a weather name for artefacts.

So that it matches the other weather names.
Add another instrument name to artefacts.

Fix felids receiving attacks while dead

Unlike monster's that count as dead while pending revival, the player
counted as alive. This caused them to to receive attacks while dead,
which usually didn't matter as most of the effects from the attacks were
cleaned up when reviving. However, not all effects are cleared on
reviving and you do end up with messages in the message log that don't
make a log of sense for a dead character. Instead, count felids that are
pending revival as dead and fix up any of the checks that should still
affect them (or a monster) when pending revival.

Fixes #4845

Fix a Crazy Yiuf quote.

Properly transcribe the line from the Principia Discordia exactly as
written.

art: Make exclusions more readable

As someone that is partially colorblind, exclusions were very difficult
for me to read when placed over certain tiles. Shoals was the biggest
culprit since the exclusions are hard to make out on top of sand and
shallow/deep sea water tiles. Exclusions were also very difficult to see
when placed over lava tiles. To address this, exclusions were given a
transparent black outline and a central white gradient.

Exclusion tiles connected with each other in a way that made it
difficult to see where the center of a tile was, since the corners had
the same crisscross pattern as the centers. I've seperated the corners
so they are no longer connected. It's possible this might be more of an
issue with the background tiles not having clear edges in some cases but
this at least makes excluded zones easier to quickly evaluate.

[Committer's notes: I've tweaked the tiles in rypofalem's PR a bit to try
to help them stand out more in areas with red backgrounds like Volcano,
and edited the above commit message accordingly. If anyone reading this
has further suggestions or graphical tweaks to help colourblind folks,
they're always welcome.

Closes #4880.]

Adjust description of the book of Transmutation.

Make it reference now-gone sludge elves, since they were known as
transmuters when both the species and the job existed in-game, and the
book has Fulsome Fusillade in it, which is thematically similar to the
now-gone Fulsome Distillation spell.

Also, at mumra's suggestion, replace the author's spider obsession with
a butterfly obsession, since spider form is currently accessible via
talisman, and butterfly form is not a thing at all.

Mark transformed protean talismans as seen.

So that the talismans they transform into don't incorrectly get a higher
chance of acquirement if we haven't seen their subtype before.
Fix comment typo.

Don't use the deprecated `math.pow()` function

There's a built-in exponentiation operator already available in Lua 5.1.
We're hoping to convert to Lua 5.4 soon, and math.pow() is only
available there via a compile-time option. Instead of doing that,
convert the few uses of math.pow() to the ^ exponentiation operator.

Remove a duplicate dlua function

`you.silenced()` was setup to return the same information as both a clua
and a dlua function, but the clua bind is usable in dlua and there's no
reason to duplicate it.

Fix bane of succour sometimes clearing xp tracking

When a monster was killed, bane of succour would heal it before we hand
out xp for the kill. If the monster died from banishment this could heal
it to full reseting its `damage_friendly` and `damage_total` that we use
to decide if the player should get xp for the kill. Fix this by not
healing the dead monster.

Fixes #4889
Add another instrumental and weapon noise.
Add another name for Hexes spellbooks.
Fix a DES typo (Odds)
Remove unneeded blank line.

Change other now-gone weapons' names internally.

To "old [weapon name]". This is done for the spiked flail, cutlass,
blowgun, and fustibalus.

This means that &o) with "s" in wizard mode will no longer produce the
now-gone spiked flail by default (there's more than one option for "s",
and you'll have to type in "old sp", at least, to get the spiked flail
specifically), and having all now-gone weapons' internal names start
with "old " is a more visible indicator that they're deprecated.

Closes #4890.

Change now-gone scythes'/hammers' internal names.

To "old scythe"/"old hammer," as is done for some other now-gone weapons
like TSO's specially blessed long blades.

With this change, looking up information on the current scythe (a.k.a.
redefined halberd) will show the proper stats of a halberd, and looking
up information on the current hammer (a.k.a. redefined mace) will show
the proper stats of a mace, in case any monsters ever wield hammers.
(I've verified that the latter works by temporarily making Sigmund do
so.)

Closes #4133.

fix: Hep's ancestor names checking the wrong DB

They were generated every time. :c

[Committer's note: Adjusted commit message.]

Adjust punctuation in a god message.

So that we don't have "says" without a comma, and so that it's in the
same style as most other god messages.

Search for/display created items w/DESC_DBNAME.

Using DESC_PLAIN adds articles, quantities, and enchantments to the
names, which won't produce accurate results for names including them.
(For example, putting in "+6 ring of slaying" at the "What type of
jewellery?" prompt in wizard mode's &o= prompt will silently produce
a +6 ring of strength.)

Also, looking up an item via a partial name creates and displays the
name of a dummy item with all of the matching item's major qualities
(including its plus) set to zero, which is inaccurate for items that
have their own non-zero default plus (e.g. rings of slaying). We
can't display the proper default plus at that point because the real
item hasn't been created yet.

Use DESC_DBNAME instead, which doesn't have articles, quantities, or
enchantments. You'll still have to pick up a ring of slaying created
via &o= and "slay" to see what its default plus is, but at least the
dummy item created and displayed beforehand will no longer display an
inaccurate plus of zero.

Closes #4886.
Fix indentation.
Add a few more writing adjectives and nouns.
Move colour patterns before coloured writing.

Fix an ldoc lua api comment (Omniraptor)

This should allow the `you.xl()` docstring to show up in the generated api
again.

Adjust a sparkling fountain decor message.

Make it pulsate any colour instead of any colour pattern, as the latter
can produce bad grammar with some patterns (e.g. it can pulsate "a
strange purple polka dots" or "a strange orange hieroglyphics").

Add coloured writing as a colour pattern option.

Pull writing nouns and adjectives from the text used by the old Tome of
Destruction, with "faded" changed to "swirling" and "glowing" changed to
"jagged" to thematically overlap less with glowing colour adjectives.

This partially reverts commit 7c428e64889cc3b410080acbca99d6fb6fa891c1.
Move glowing colours before colour patterns.

Fix warning about redefining integer limits in MSVC

We were checking if the c language version was at least c99 otherwise we
were defining our own integer limits. However, we were doing this in a
c++ file and MSVC doesn't define a c version when compiling c++. We
can't use a c++ version check either as MSVC always defined its c++
version as before c++11. Instead skip defining these limits if the c
version is high enough or if compiling with MSVC.

Don't leak info about polar vortex casters

Polar vortex clouds have a phase that is based on the caster's location
or random if the spell has ended. This could help locate the caster
after teleporting away or otherwise moving out of sight (although if
playing tiles you had to reload the game to get out of view clouds to
update their phase due to a bug). Instead, only update the phase of
polar vortex clouds you can see, so you only gain information from in
view clouds.

Describe conditions for sniping ego (RypoFalem).

This ports the text change from #4745 (plus a spelling fix) to current
trunk.

feat: Rampage stacking

Here we let most sources of rampage stack up to 3, with the appropriate
handling for the overlay UI and Armataur rollpage regen. Stabs are
enabled(!) for stacked rampage under the reasoning that players still have
to find and equip multiple sources of rampage to benefit from this, which
is far from guaranteed in any given game.

Should multi-tile sleep stabbing prove too powerful we can revisit the
chance to wake as a function of distance travelled in the future, but for
now I'm fully enabling stacked rampage stab behavior.

Seven-league boots still have the special-cased no-sleep-stab behavior for
now, as they get all of their rampage from one slot.

Enjoy folks!
Add another Xom "send in the clones" message.
Fix comment typo.

Adjust orange crystal wall description.

To differentiate it a bit from ordinary crystal, as is done for white
crystal already.
Remove now-unused pink crystal wall description.

Remove the other Nemelex pink crystal wall desc.

So that it really is no longer used in the othe vault.

Revert "Properly use pink crystal wall desc."

This reverts commit c2427cda9cbcef240201f71ecc8d0e0404416a28.

It was no longer used in the other vault, and the color of walls
shouldn't be specified by default.
Remove an extraneous semicolon (gammafunk)

Remove a netted monster blink check

Since 2e68b5db91 (2014), monsters with SPELL_BLINK have had a 1/15 chance
to cast blink instead of their other spells if caught in a net/web. This
had minimal impact on monster behavior, so here we simplify it out.

(These mons will still try to cast blink while netted, but using their
otherwise-normal weighting.)

I did consider approaching this from the opposite direction, and instead
*increasing* the chance while expanding these escape spells to include
things beyond blink, but the end result of that would have been that
players with nets would need to be much more aware of the specifics of the
spellsets their net targets. This expected UX of incentivizing players
to press xv before huckin' nets seems like it would make for worse
gameplay, so I'm not doing that.

Remove actor ground_level methods

These were added in db74bba88a (2011) to support clinging, which was
removed in 53d2a09ee0 (2019), and have since stuck around as rump methods
that needlessly duplicated airborne.

Skip setting useless skills in fsim (pooka109)

defence fsim by default estimates the damage you would take with various
levels of armour skill. However, some races can't train armour and
trying to set its level results in a crash. To fix this, don't try to
set the level of useless skills as they won't have any effect anyway.

Fixes #4875

Add assert for now regarding Zot runes.

The routine used when putting Zot runes into the gate lock assumes
exactly three runes, so assert that it's equal to three. If the number
of runes needed to enter Zot changes, it'll need to be fixed manually.

Fix clearing some remembered foreground tiles

Remembered monster and cloud tiles would be incorrectly cleared for
squares in LOS range that weren't in LOS. This was broken in
commit b2c7929

Adjust the Zot minimum rune message.

Use the #defined number instead of hardcoding "three".
Fix warning.

Properly use #defines for rune counts.

Use ZOT_ENTRY_RUNES instead of hardcoding 3, and add a MAX_RUNES defined
as 15 instead of hardcoding 15.

The Xom routines checking for rune counts are odd; given the original
numbers, I'm assuming the rune counts (and all divisors used on them)
are supposed to be relative to the number of runes required for Zot,
which should produce the same results as before as long as that number
stays 3.

Don't hardcode max rune count in title checks.

Use you.obtainable_runes instead.

This also means that Sprint modes with max rune counts other than 15
will be able to get these titles.

Remove a no longer needed tile cache

We had a cache for tiles of squares in view and another one for all
other tiles. This allowed us to easily set tiles to unseen as they
exited view in the Labyrinth branch by never writing them to the out of
view tile cache (Labyrinth no longer exists), replace mcache reference
tiles for monsters out of view with generic ones (but the bug that
caused us to do this is gone and we no longer do this), and support the
clean_map option (which no longer exists). As none of these reasons for
keeping the two separate caches exist anymore it should be fine to just
use one cache for all tiles.

The cache for tiles in view stored tiles within a radius of 8 from the
player and was indexed with coordinates that were relative to the
player. This meant it would become invalid after the player moved if it
wasn't updated and was sometimes leading to a crash in webtiles when
drawing parchments. Using a single cache indexed by grid coordinates
should fix this.
Add another Orb of Zot greatness adjective.

Properly use pink crystal wall desc.

Make sure it's in both Nemelex overflow altars with goblin sharpers.
Remove unneeded brackets and breaks.
Fix missing brackets.

fix: overflow vault cloud typo (srcrip) (#4878)

Fixes the placement of decorative thin mist clouds.

Fixes the placement of decorative thin mist clouds.

Fixes the placement of decorative thin mist clouds.

commit.message:
Unify status icon sizes between web and local tiles

Webtiles had a list of widths of status icons in a javascript file and
localtiles had a similar list in a c++ file. However, the localtiles
list was missing a lot of entries and there were some minor differences
where one of the lists had an incorrect value.

The reason for the missing values in the localtiles list is that it had
a default value and you couldn't tell if this value resulted in bad
spacing between the icons without having multiple icons on a monster so
it was often missed when adding a status icon. Webtiles on the other
hand just doesn't show a status icon if it doesn't have a width for it
which resulted in widths being added to its list when it was noticed
that the status icon wasn't showing up in webtiles.

To fix these problems, move the list of status icon widths to a text
file and generate the javascript and c++ lists from this. Also, give an
error message in the message log when trying to draw a status icon
without a width in localtiles. This should allow testing a new status
icon in either web or local tiles and have it just work in the other.

Yet more catch-up vault review

 * Another line-compressing simplification function has been added to
   vault.lua and spread around, `single_cloud(_G, glyph, cloud, fade)`,
   which provides two different settings for a cloud generator that never
   leaves the one spot and is relatively consistent at being always or
   nearly always present.

 * Pre-lair Necropolis subvaults using generic D enemies now heavily
   specify the majority of their contents. While this was done for the
   sake of rock fish escaping, it also avoids a few other annoyances,
   like the optimality of checking for the slim chance of early unseen
   horrors if one can identify subvaults as themeless, or moving around to
   try and make efreet fire trails kill other monsters before engaging a
   given subvault. (It may be reasonable to further investigate preventing
   e.g. all wall-walking monsters from spawning in Necropolis entirely, as
   the only real troubled area regarding explicitly optional sections such
   behaviour can break, but this should function fine enough for now and
   is needed to handle those other cases.)

 * Trove magic item handling now accomodates Djinn properly to exclude
   books and nonfunctional orb types, and also allow one to get a fair bit
   more orb randart type variety than previously. This somewhat addresses
   #4860, though that issue also brings up heavy armour trove drops for
   mages that are too impractical to assess versus stats / skills /
   species beyond what acquirement and trove_ego_gen_armour already tries
   to handle.

 * nicolae_gauntlet_exit_dead_adventurers no longer uses delayed_decay
   arrangements for its skeletons as was made unnecessary by 7d43067.
   A small amount of its species have been also swapped around to use
   player species not often seen in the Dungeon, to try to emphasize
   it more as using player adventurers rather than just some random
   dead people.

Don't use std::map::emplace

The compiler used on the CAO server doesn't seem to support it, despite
it being added in c++11
Use you.can_smell() in yet another book desc.
Fix capitalisation.
Properly use you.can_smell() in a book desc.
Fix spelling.
Fix spelling.
Add another Uskayaw ghost line.

Calm down MUT_BERSERK (Lici)

Reduce berserkitis' random mutation weight to zero as it was otherwise
removed in 143df15cc6.

Give Slaughter form rMiasma (Acrobat)

It hadn't actually ocurred to me that demons all naturally had rMiasma
(even if not poison-immune) and this seems a harmless buff.

Fully remove a function

Forgot this in f77e99c820, oops.

Simplify Vehumet spell gift weighting

The root cause of the Vehumet crashes in 5347199fb9 was actually that
some Vehumet spells were tagged as destructive and thus supported by
Vehumet, but didn't have their spell schools present in Veh's list
of supported schools. The code determining this was both buggy and
overcomplex for no good reason; it was only being called in one place.

Here we simplify this by removing the notion of Vehumet supported schools
entirely: If a spell returns true from `vehumet_supports_spell()`, we now
assume that whatever schools it uses are destructive enough to be
accounted for when checking Vehumet spell gift weights.

In practice, the difference here is that now Forgecraft spells with
spflag::destructive will show up as Vehumet gifts more frequently, as
their gifting weights will no longer return 0.

(We do retain the averaged school weighting from 71ebbbb606 here.)

Fix a Vehumet div by zero crash (Jarek1)

71ebbbb606 introduced a crash where characters with zero in all spell
skills taking Vehumet would cause the game to divide by zero as it tried
to issue their first spell gift and came up empty.

Say when targeting an immune monster with lesser beckoning

When targeting stationary monsters (e.g. tesseracts) it would tell you
that you had a 100% chance of hitting rather than telling you that they
are not susceptible.

Resolves #4760

Change lesser beckoning message when target immune

when hitting an immune monster with lesser beckoning, it should tell
you that the monster is unaffected. However, it was giving the generic
nothing appears to happen message as the beam code didn't know when a
monster is immune to it.

Fix low-HD monster staff damage display (#4654).

Staff damage should never be less than zero, since the actual staff
damage formula is never less than zero (it only uses random2() and
addition).
Fix spacing.

Fix delay info leak on artefact heavy weapons.

The dummy weapon that has the original weapon's heavy brand replaced
with a normal brand now *also* has the normal brand set if it's an
artefact, so that get_weapon_brand() will properly return SPWPN_NORMAL
instead of SPWPN_HEAVY for the latter case.

Closes #4708.

Fix wildshape skill estimation for talismans

Resolves #4873.

[Committer's note: Adjusted commit message.]

Update Vehumet's gift weighting to consider averages

It seems wrong that we are more likely to offer multischool spells;
e.g. offering Chain Lightning more than MCC to a mage with 20 air magic
and 5 conjurations feels off. So we update the weighting to consider the
average skill of (revelant) schools, rather than the sum.

Since Veh's spells average around 1.6 schools, we then increase the
weight of the preference by a similar amount so that on average we
should get about as many relevant gifts.

Also do a light cleanup and rename of destructive_elemental_preference,
since we probably won't want the elemental-only version of this function
again.

Fixup some clua api documentation

Previously, the api docs for you.activate_ability and spells.path were
mangled due to some ldoc formatting errors in their comments.

Also, spells.path actually defaults to `aimed_at_spot = true`.
Is this intentional?

Remove a clua make api you.ability_table reference

This was missed in 0e37d8b8bd.
Tweak Blorkula's msg for re-forming from one bat.

Fix messaging for surrendering bat-form Blorkula.

Display a message indicating he's re-formed into an orc just before
surrendering instead of showing it silently.

Closes #4137.

Don't insert empty entries in tile_env.icons

tile_env.icons is a std::map so when we used its array index operator to
get an element by key it inserts a default constructed element if there
wasn't an element in it with that key already. This results in it always
having an element for every square in sight, rather defeating the
whole reason for using a map. Instead we should use its `find` method
which doesn't insert elements.

Fix phantom tentacles

These were broken in the case of cloning an eldritch tentacle which had
moved, because the base position was being cloned.

Allow &% in wizmode to produce excluded items.

create_item_named() is currently only used in wizard mode, so it now
always creates the specified item regardless of whether it's excluded.

Closes #4422.
Add another real song to the Singing Sword.

Destroy shafts when pacified monsters use them.

As is done with shafts everywhere else.

Closes #4356.

Identify items created via &% in wizmode.

Closes #4420.

Fix FTILE entry.

So that the special flooring is also under the door, the glass walls,
and the monster, as is done in the zin_angel vault.

Fix log on zero contamination

The contamination level for small amounts of contamination is zero,
so this was not triggering.

Add another Nemelex overflow altar (#4852)

This has the goblin sharper on its own, without the Zin angel.

[Committer's notes: Mildly lowered the weight, due to the vault using
distinct decorative tiles, a special decorative statue type, and a
nearly-unique talkative monster. This isn't inappropriate for the excess
one can attach to the gambling-themed Nemelex, but it's enough that I
want to hold back just a _little_ on it.

Merges #4852.]

Tweak some monster elemental spell text

 * "Fire Summon" is an awful name for a top-tier spell cast by two
   seperate demon lords guarding runes of Zot- it's about as bad as if
   Dispater had a unique spell called "Earth Conjuration". In anticipation
   of other possible high-level elemental group summons for randlords in
   the future, I am renaming the spell to "Hellfire Court"- a precedent
   set up by Hellfire Mortar as well as a nod to long-past older names for
   2/3 of the summons' attacks. It also now actually has a cast message,
   instead of just "Cerebov gestures." (Really, most summon spells could
   probably do with such?)

 * Beckoning Gale's damage number on monster displays is now light gray
   instead of dark gray, matching the colouration of Airstrike.

Let wizmode make food caches (Monkooky)

The internal vaultname for food caches didn't use underscores like other
features do (e.g. altars, fountains), which made &( unable to make any of
them (as it'd fill in spaces with underscores). Since this was already
an inconsistent approach between feature names, I've changed those internal
vaultnames for fruit, meat, and baked caches to use underscores, which
requires far less effort than it looks to produce such consistency and
let wizmode access them both.

Remove berserkitis (DracoOmega)

The majority of other bad mutations are substantially less lethal than
constantly having to monitor one's combat actions later on to avoid
situations where the slim chance of going Berserk also disabling
consumables, invocations, and spells can directly result in one's death.
(It also can be very lethal when received mid-combat without noticing it,
which makes it fairly awkward to always make an option for malmutators.)
As a downside, it strongly encourages tedious luring far more directly than
the generalized maluses of other mutation or equipment penalties, since
there's far less need to escape when berserk provides net direct help with
one-on-one combats. As a mechanic, the mutation directly overlaps with how
randarts already have *Rage as a direct re-use, which somewhat function
with a much higher chance to happen there as one thus opts into.

Berserkitis may have been kept for a long time for legacy reasons, but
as both the spree of good mutations over the past few versions and the
new elemental orb monsters demonstrate for strategic damage, there's
enough design space still left in downsides we can reasonably come up with
more for the sake of mutation variety. (We could even plausibly have more
mutations that specifically worsen melee combat enough to get the one
positive component of berserkitis, in making characters rely more on
Throwing and Evocations when particularly endangered).

Outside of that one positive bit, however, berserkitis as a mutation is
inherently troubled enough that multiple devs would prefer to cut it
entirely and work on new bad mutations instead. Such work, alongside more
review for the other large outliers of dangerous mutations, is slated to
be done relative soon this version.

Cut Reckless's SH penalty in half (DracoOmega)

After a fair bit of discussion between various experienced players and
developers, it's been made reasonably clear that the same inconsistencies
of effects between characters that moved Reckless from a Bane to a
mutation is still somewhat dissatisfying for heavily affecting some
characters more than others, especially with the orb rework making some be
a reasonable choice for casters. (Two-handers may be more attractive with
future new systems, but such systems still won't offset the immediate
penalties of losing a bigger shield.) To preserve the spirit of the
mutation, and to try and continue establishing bad mutations as having
middle grounds between Dex-2 and teleportitis, this cuts the shield
penalty in half- enough that one can tough it out, but also still feel a
difference between having invested into a buckler or a tower shield.

Allow igniting poisoned allies

The tracer codepath in cast_ignite_poison was being used in two
different ways - to decide if the spell was useless, and to check if
monsters should cast it. These wanted different criteria, and so the
uselessness check was wrong. We split the check by adding a separate
function to do the check for monsters.

Fixes #4858

Add check for targets in plasma beam

Fixes a bad behaviour where casting plasma beam with some monsters but
no targettable monsters could waste a turn and MP.

Fixes #3337

Fix changed terrain counting as known

Changed terrain that the player hadn't seen or otherwise revealed would
show the blue magic mapped background when excluded, it would also cause
the minimap to be centered as if you had seen the terrain causing it to
sometimes be off center.

Add Odds to the credits

For 7267fc8787, b014eb5195, and hopefully more PRs yet-to-be-merged.
Thanks for your help!
Fix typos.

Fix Warlock's Mirror reflecting charm under Okawaru

Also prevents applying charm to monsters with Ru's Sacrifice Love.
Fixes #4837.

Update regen talisman comment again.

Mention the hurdle that regen attunement checks currently require all
the items they check to have corresponding equipment slots, and
talismans are slotless.
Fix slightly misleading wording (DracoOmega).
